overview: Repertoire will cover a wide range of styles and will consist of large ensemble pieces as well as duets, trios and quartets. To join the guitar ensemble, reasonable sight reading skills are required and the preferred instrument is nylon string guitar.

This subject is co-taught with MUSI10174 Guitar Ensemble 2 (Breadth), MUSI20090 Guitar Ensemble 2, and MUSI30182 Guitar Ensemble 2. Students cannot simultaneously enrol in co-taught subjects in the same study period.
intended learning outcomes: show technical development as ensemble musicians;
participate with ability and self-confidence as a team member of a performing group;
perform selected repertoire to concert standard;
identify and exhibit specific knowledge of a range of ensemble repertoire;
exhibit an informed respect for the values and principles of ensemble performance.

assessments.description: Regular in-class group assessment of part preparation. 600 words (equivalent)
Active participation in all rehearsals and performances as directed. 200 words (equivalent)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend 100% of all scheduled classes, rehearsals and performances as directed.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 24 hours, comprising one 2-hour rehearsal per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
